    • Constructor Detail

      • Move

        public Move(int oldrow,
            int oldcol,
            int newrow,
            int newcol,
            Piece moved,
            byte[][] boardIn,
            boolean canKingSideCastleIn,
            boolean canQueenSideCastleIn,
            boolean forWhite,
            boolean taken)
        Constructs a new Move
        Parameters:
        oldrow - to be moved from
        oldcol - to be moved from
        newrow - to be moved to
        newcol - to be moved to
        moved, - piece moved on turn
        boardIn, - ByteBoard to be stored
        canKingSideCastleIn, - whether or not king could castle last Move
        canQueenSideCastleIn, - whether or not queen could castle last Move
        forWhite, - side move is for
        taken - whether a piece was taken this turn

      • Move

            int oldcol,
            int newrow,
            int newcol,
            int castleType,

        Constructs a new Move
        Parameters:
        oldrow - to be moved from
        oldcol - to be moved from
        newrow - to be moved to
        newcol - to be moved to
        castleType - KINGSIDE_CASTLE or QUEENSIDE_CASTLE
        boardIn, - ByteBoard to be stored

      • setNotation

        @Deprecated
public void setNotation()
        Deprecated. because notation is already set in construction, re-setting notation could lead to the WRONG information being set if called at the wrong time
        Can be used to set the notation of a move

      • calcPiecePrefix

        public final java.lang.String calcPiecePrefix(Piece piece,
                                              int[] old,
                                              int[] loc)
        Calculates the piece prefix to be used In the event there are multiple pieces of the same type that game move to the same location, the piece moved needs a position specifier Follows preference of 1.Col 2.Row 3.Col+Row
        Parameters:
        piece, - piece to find notation for
        old, - old position of the move
        loc, - new location the piece is moved to
        Returns:
        the piece prefix as string (including position specifier if needed)

      • getCharacterNotation

        public static java.lang.String getCharacterNotation(int num)
        Returns the character notation for a given number
        Parameters:
        num, - the number (typically a Column)
        Returns:
        the notation
